trans-unit.source: Name of either the redirected local device or the remote network resource to disconnect from.

seg-source.mrk: Name of either the redirected local device or the remote network resource to disconnect from.

target.mrk: Name of either the redirected local device or the remote network resource to disconnect from.

trans-unit.source: When this parameter specifies a redirected local device, the function cancels only the specified device redirection.

seg-source.mrk: When this parameter specifies a redirected local device, the function cancels only the specified device redirection.

target.mrk: When this parameter specifies a redirected local device, the function cancels only the specified device redirection.

trans-unit.source: If the parameter specifies a remote network resource, only the connections to remote networks without devices are cancelled.

seg-source.mrk: If the parameter specifies a remote network resource, only the connections to remote networks without devices are cancelled.

target.mrk: If the parameter specifies a remote network resource, only the connections to remote networks without devices are cancelled.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether or not the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether or not the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection.

target.mrk: Specifies whether or not the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is False, the function fails if there are open files or jobs.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is False, the function fails if there are open files or jobs.

target.mrk: If this parameter is False, the function fails if there are open files or jobs.

trans-unit.source: This function is provided for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

seg-source.mrk: This function is provided for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

target.mrk: This function is provided for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: Other Windows-based applications should call the _WinNet_CancelConnection2() function.

seg-source.mrk: Other Windows-based applications should call the _WinNet_CancelConnection2() function.

target.mrk: Other Windows-based applications should call the _WinNet_CancelConnection2() function.
